intro: Urophyllum ziamaeanum, commonly known as the Zairian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
